translation.title: Shadowban Scanner for Twitter / X
translation.description: The official site for the Shadowban Scanner extension, which detects shadowbans and sensitive content flags on Twitter (X).
translation.detectAccountsShadowbanAndSensitiveFlags: Detect account shadowbans and sensitive content flags
Check if a Twitter account is shadowbanned or flagged as sensitive. You can check both your account and other people's accounts.
translation.detectTweetsSensitiveFlagsAndAgeRestrict: Detect sensitive content flags and age restrictions on tweets
Check if tweets are flagged as sensitive or have age restrictions.
translation.detectSensitiveFlagsInProfileMedia: Detect sensitive content flags in profile media
translation.detectSensitiveFlagsInProfileMediaDescri: Verify if your Twitter profile media is flagged as sensitive.
translation.detectCountriesBlockingYourAccountDescri: Some countries may block accounts for legal reasons. Check if any countries are blocking your account and identify which ones.
translation.addButtonToShowHiddenTweets: Add buttons to show hidden tweets
translation.addButtonToShowHiddenTweetsDescription: On Twitter, some tweets containing external links may be hidden. This feature adds buttons to reveal those hidden tweets.
translation.noAccessToExternalWebsitesDescription: Shadowban Scanner displays results directly on your tweets and profile. There is no need to visit external websites. It also does not access external servers or Twitter's internal APIs, protecting your privacy and data.
translation.openSourceDescription: The source code is available on GitHub. All features are completely free to use.
translation.supportedBrowsers: Shadowban Scanner supports Chrome, Edge, and Firefox.
translation.smartphonesAreNotSupportedDescription: For technical reasons, Shadowban Scanner is only available for PC browsers, Android Firefox and Android Kiwi Browser.
